title: Version 19.6.3 is broken due to refactoring
body:
## Description

I installed a new `19.6.3` version from pip. Trying to run 30 seconds tutorial got such an error:
```
>>> from catalyst.dl.experiments import SupervisedRunner
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/cris/miniconda3/envs/dl/lib/python3.6/site-packages/catalyst/dl/experiments/__init__.py", line 2, in <module>
    from .core import Experiment, Runner
  File "/Users/cris/miniconda3/envs/dl/lib/python3.6/site-packages/catalyst/dl/experiments/core.py", line 10, in <module>
    from catalyst.dl.state import RunnerState
  File "/Users/cris/miniconda3/envs/dl/lib/python3.6/site-packages/catalyst/dl/state.py", line 6, in <module>
    from catalyst.utils.misc import FrozenClass
ImportError: cannot import name 'FrozenClass'
```

After checking sources looks like `FrozenClass` was moved to `catalyst.utils.frozen`. After fixing import directly in the installed package it started producing a new error:
```
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/cris/miniconda3/envs/dl/lib/python3.6/site-packages/catalyst/dl/experiments/__init__.py", line 2, in <module>
    from .core import Experiment, Runner
  File "/Users/cris/miniconda3/envs/dl/lib/python3.6/site-packages/catalyst/dl/experiments/core.py", line 11, in <module>
    from catalyst.dl.utils import UtilsFactory
ImportError: cannot import name 'UtilsFactory'
```
I did not check further and just used `19.6.2`. It worked well.

Looks like `master` already has required fixes, maybe it makes sense to release a new version or remove `19.6.3` because it's broken.
